answers.answer: Preeclampsia is just not safe for mommy...if your kidneys are leaking protein and your blood pressure is rising significantly, they will take baby out sooner than later. With my first, I didn't start having these symptoms till I was well in my third trimester, with them taking baby at 38 weeks. All you really can do is hope that things don't get worst as baby needs more time to cook. Good luck.

I had an appointment yday I am 38 weeks and my bp was 145/84 but no protein in my urine but doc took some blood test to see preclampsia and gave me 24 hour urine I am having repeat c section March 9th drink alot of water take less salt ull.b fine and try monitoring ur np at home
I'm just worried I'm ready showing signs & I'm not even 20 weeks yet. Guess well see at the next apt!!

I had +1 at my appointment about 3 weeks ago. I already have high blood pressure even before i got pregnant. But anyways, my doctor had said it could be the beginning of getting pre-e (had it with my first) or because i was dehydrated. I started to increase my water intake and went back a few days later and had no protein at all. I go back tomorrow for another Dr. Visit. Im 32 weeks though. I wish you the best and hope you dont get it! Especially this early! <3

I'm hoping that's the case. I've never had it even when dehydrated so he took urine & sent it off to rule out infection. I've also never had high bp so were going to keep an eye on it. I'm going to do home monitoring of the bp and take a log to my next apt in 3 weeks

question: Today I had my second visit with my ob. I had 1+ protien & and my bp has been borderline high - max I've recorded 140/90. I have another apt in 3 weeks and if the protein is still there I'll be doing a 24 hour urine. I'm 15.3 weeks - at the next apt I'll be 18.4. What happens if this is pre e? Has anyone experienced pre e before? I'm kind of worried.
title: Preeclampsia
